intro: Fimbristylis vaginata, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, each bearing small, three-lobed flowers. Fimbristylis vaginata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
